title: Ticket #110: Change ProcD to run without root privilege
description:
The ProcD currently requires root privilege for two purposes:

  1. To get information about the processes on the system
  2. To send signals

These two functions could fairly easily be made PrivSep switchboard operations, which would allow the ProcD to run without root. This would reduce the size of root-running code in PrivSep mode by quite a bit, and would let us more safely add additional capabilities to the ProcD (e.g. dprintf logging).
remarks:
2009-Feb-17 15:47:04 by tannenba:
Note the work in the ticket is really work to the switchboard, not the procd. Also note that the purpose of doing this ticket isn't so much for increased security, but more so the procd can use bigger (and maybe less secure) libraries like daemoncore and dprintf that would allow us to more easily debug it.

2009-Mar-04 10:27:53 by gquinn:
Note that the above mentioned new switchboard operations should be limited to "seeing" or killing processes that are owned by users that Condor has access to, as configured in the Switchboard's configuration file.

2019-Oct-21 09:35:23 by tim:
PrivSep (#4057) and switchboard (#6259) are gone. Abandoning this ticket.
